channel.title: Hunters (!)= Murderers
channel.description:
I was talking to my friend while driving down a country road. A deer crossed the street, and it was well ahead of me so I thought nothing of it. Then, as I approached where it was, it ran [i]back[/i] to the other side. I slammed on my breaks and almost drove off the road. But that's past the point; basically this got my friend to tell me something about what he heard from somewhere (he didn't tell me where). He said that some people actually hit small animals on purpose, because in their mind they're set as "killers" and have to kill something to get their "fix" rather than actually killing a person. This is believable; what really got me to thinking was what he said next. He brought up a show he saw once on the history channel that explained how Hunters and Murderers are similar in brain patterns. There have been scientific test on the way they think, and in many ways they mirror each other.
So, What do you have to say about it? Are you a hunter? Do you believe this? Do you have more information on this?
Discuss...

item.title: Hunters (!)= Murderers
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I’d say hunters = murderers. The definition of murder, as defined in an online dictionary, is in short, ‘to kill intentionally’. When you hunt, you’re killing animals intentionally, therefore making you a murderer.

Read full topic

item.title: Hunters (!)= Murderers
item.dc:creator: @Xx_R_A_G_3_R Xx R A G 3 R
item.description:
@Xx_R_A_G_3_R wrote:

Hunting, Murderers. Both killing for a reason. Some murderers kill for revenge, or maybe even just the joy / excitement of killing another human being. Hunters kill animals, maybe for money, or maybe for food. Either way I see it as both of them killing for a purpose, and Murderers may see human beings as their prey. That’s my take on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hunters (!)= Murderers
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:303184”]That is the stupidest thing I have ever heard. I don’t know why murderers murder people, but people (like me) hunt animals for food, and to keep down the population because people have ran off or killed the natural predators of these animals. If it weren’t for people hunting deer, you wouldn’t be able to drive down the road at all without hitting one.

You are welcome.[/quote]

Agreed, but i think maybe people kill other people due to an under lying childhood problem maybe, as for the younger children murders I can explain maybe too many video games?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 22-09-2009, 19:47:43[/size][hr][quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:303184”]Hunting: Killing for survival
Murdering: Killing because you can

Pretty simple eh?[/quote]
Murdering: Killing Becuase You Can? that the most stupiest thing ive heard, you hunt because you can., Murdering is to kill somebody with a motive, there is a reason people kill somebody ussaly revenge.

item.title: Hunters (!)= Murderers
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:11, topic:303184”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=399440.msg2963661#msg2963661 date=1253415628]
Hunting: Killing for survival
Murdering: Killing because you can

Pretty simple eh?
[/quote]

What if you eat people.[/quote]

Then your a cannibal and deserve to be killed.

But anyway’s I did a little research and this is what i got so far…

my question:
Are hunter’s and murder’s alike?

Answer’s:
Yes, they have the same brain pattern. Hunter’s kill for joy, and food.
Murders kill for joy, and to prove power over another being.

In my conclusion, they are the same in ways… But hunter’s are not fucked up in the head.

Read full topic

I don’t know why murderers murder people, but people (like me) hunt animals for food, and to keep down the population because people have ran off or killed the natural predators of these animals. If it weren’t for people hunting deer, you wouldn’t be able to drive down the road at all without hitting one.

You are welcome.[/quote]

Thanks baby, but opinion vs. facts. I’m not sure if there is actually proof of the significant brainwaves, and brainwaves can be almost completely symmetrical but the person could think in a completely different way. So both sides of the argument are not really supported by stable facts.

Edit:
My opinion is I just love to destroy thing’s. I don’t have the intention of killing a person, but I love the feeling of welding a powerful weapon, and the adrenaline rush of killing something such as a deer.
